p: The map that displayed the total ZIKV incidence rate by neighbourhood showed a focus of high incidence in parts of the northern and the southwestern areas of the city ( Figure S7). The global univariate Moranâ€™s I statistic for the total incidence of ZIKV during the study period was 0.031 (pseudo p-value 0.191); thus, there was not a clear global clustering pattern for this infection in Barranquilla. However, the LISA analysis showed three distinct small hotspots in the northern, southwestern and southern areas of the city ( Figure S8).
